title: Not following the meta dodging
body:
Some people get very upset when I play something that I feel comfortable with, for example nami, morgana and karma mid. I have even been forced to support since someone wasnt happy with my nami mid.
I get shocked when people go crazy when I play Morgana mid which is what she was made for anyway.
Someone dodged when I said I'm playing Morgana top.
Another time a person who supports warwick was told to go jungle.

Why do people force a person to play with the "meta" and if you get beaten in lane its like report this troll.
Most importantly people dodge and do not let you play your champion.

replies.body: Because the majority of the time you run into a player who plays something off meta in a position that they shouldnt be playing it in (zac support), it ends up going badly, and the player ends up trolling, and when you see that, every zac support you see, you assume is going to be horrible and feed. If im in a lobby with someone playing an off meta champion, i op.gg them and check out their winrate with that champ, if its low i usually dodge. For example, your winrate on soraka is 42%, even though your name has soraka in it, so i would never let you play her anywhere other than support. But your anivia winrate is 89%, so i would suggest you play her in mid, instead of soraka.

Yeah but that is sooo limited and lazy, my pantheon winrate was 85% at one point and I had played less then 15 games with him but my yasuo win rate is 55% and I have played 107 games with him (or around, haven't checked recently).

Normals btw

Does that mean I'm a better pantheon?

More importantly old stats for any reason (your were learning the game/ champ) do not affect how you play now...

The fact that you are dodging from statistics on an elitist website shows that you are what heart vine described above

No, if i check your match history and you won 3 out of your 4 past amumu support games, i wont dodge. But if you won 0 out of your past 5 ad thresh top games, im 100% dodging. Its called being smart. Im not sure why you think your input is valued since you have less than 15 ranked games ever.

I played much more games with soraka, and i only play her support. I didnt know how to play her properly so lately ive been winning more than losing. Anivia is a newer champ j started to play. My old losses wreaked my rate.

Mid soraka is okay in lane but falls off midgane with insane heals i dont lije her mid. She relies on her enemy not dodging star calls.
I see morgana mid all the time, like cho gath
Initially designed does not equal meta.

I play shaco ap top people get annoyed of me doing it yet i go 4/0 by 15 mins then get called useless and i ksâ€¦ Don't let people get to you for what you love doing just DO IT.. {{champion:267}} {{item:3089}}

This actually doesn't happen a lot to me, so I consider myself VERY lucky even if I get paranoid over breaking the meta for this reason. I duo queue with a friend and we both play mid champions on bottom lane, right now our best combo is MS Xerath+AP LeBlanc.

It works better than ADC+Supp in late game+early game, but it's more reliant on a good jg than ADC+Supp and mid game is horrifying.
